resources.string: Roosevelt Park is one of the many expansive parks in the New Jersey suburbs. No matter the weather there is always something to do at the park.
Not to be confused with the museum in West Orange, this 171-acre county park is adjacent to both Middlesex County College & Raritan Center.
This park has giant green chairs with a beautiful garden and a bamboo forest.
Decent park with a small lake with fountain, a couple baseball diamonds, a soccer field, a skate park and some picnics tables in the woods.
Bonhamtown is an unincorporated community located within Edison Township in Middlesex County, New Jersey, United States. The area was named after Nicholas Bonham, a freeholder from the 17th century.
Clara Barton is an unincorporated community located within Edison Township in Middlesex County, New Jersey, United States.
Lindenau is an unincorporated community located within Edison Township in Middlesex County, New Jersey, United States.
In 1876, Thomas Edison set up his home and research laboratory in Menlo Park, which at the time was the site of an unsuccessful real estate development named after the town of Menlo Park, California.
Nixon is an unincorporated community located within Edison Township in Middlesex County, New Jersey, United States. It was named after Lewis Nixon, a manufacturer and community leader.

Pumptown is an unincorporated community located within Edison Township in Middlesex County, New Jersey, United States. Pumptown is a suburban neighborhood (based on population density) located in Edison, New Jersey.
A video game company headquartered in Edison
The international HQ in US is in Edison

The Benjamin Shotwell House, or the Shotwell-Runyon House, is a historic house in Edison, Middlesex County, New Jersey. The house was listed on the New Jersey Register of Historic Places and National Register of Historic Places in 1987. The farm on which is located in part of Route 287. The Shotwells were early settlers of \"The Plains\", an early reference to Plainfield, New Jersey.

Homestead Farm at Oak Ridge is a historic home and grounds in Clark (Union County) and Edison (Middlesex County), New Jersey, United States, that was listed on the New Jersey Register of Historic Places and National Register of Historic Places in 1995. The c. 1750 building and site is located what was once Ash Swamp that played a pivotal role in the American Revolutionary War Battle of Short Hills.

Laing House of Plainfield Plantation is a historic house in Edison, Middlesex County, New Jersey, United States, built in the early 18th century when the region was being settled by Scottish Quakers in the late 17th and early 18th century, as recalled in the name of The Plainfields and Scotch Plains.The region was part of the colonial era Elizabethtown Tract and later part of Piscataway Township.
